attributes.action: Veto the result of the EU referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
The £350 million saved from leaving the EU was an exaggerated amount and will not go towards the NHS funds.
There will still be free movement of labour, even after leaving the EU.
Leaving the EU will likely lead to a Scottish and Northern Ireland referendum-dividing the nation further.
Prices of everyday goods will increase.
Unemployment will increase.
attributes.background: We ask that parliament disregards the choice made by the British public to leave the EU, given that many of the leave campaign's arguments were found to be false and misleading to voters, and that people given the present circumstances have had cause to change their minds.

rejection.details:
we think the following petition is similar to yours:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/134345
